metadata.Title: CVE-2012-4502 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer overflows in pktlength.c in Chrony before 1.29 allowremote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted (1)REQ_SUBNETS_ACCESSED or (2) REQ_CLIENT_ACCESSES command request to thePKL_CommandLength function or crafted (3) RPY_SUBNETS_ACCESSED, (4)RPY_CLIENT_ACCESSES, (5) RPY_CLIENT_ACCESSES_BY_INDEX, or (6)RPY_MANUAL_LIST command reply to the PKL_ReplyLength function, whichtriggers an out-of-bounds read or buffer overflow.  NOTE: versions 1.27 and1.28 do not require authentication to exploit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-4502` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chrony - 1.29-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chrony package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.29-1').
